chapter.title: Nepomuk Contacts Ontology (NCO): All about contacts. Rough equivalent of the VCARD standard.

listitem.para: © 2007 DFKI © 2009 Nokia. The ontologies are made available under the terms of NEPOMUK software license (FIXME verify)

sect2.title: Introduction
sect2.para: This is the ontology modelling contacts and postal addresses. It also extends the original nepomuk adding the Instant Messaging account details, because an 'identity' in an IM account can be consider also a contact.
FIXME This documentation must be completed.

refsect2.title: A contact in this ontology
refsect2.para: Document here how a contact with work and personal details is represented in the ontology. So far the QtContacts API is using this model to store the information internally, document here all the assumptions they are doing in the code, so a client using pure Sparql is completely compatible with that information
Do not forget contact groups and affiliations

refsect2.title: Postal Address
refsect2.para: Postal address class nco:PostalAddress represents a point in the space defined by the usual street, number, postal code textual data. Most of its parameters come from the RFC 2426 section 3.2.1 with few extensions for more granular APIs (nco:county and nco:district)

refsect2.title: IM Accounts and contacts
refsect2.para: Explain here how to represent the accounts of 'me' and the contacts coming from the accounts. Do not forget to explain how do we merge the same user in different accounts under one 'identity'. Also the authorization flow.

refsect2.title: Special remarks
refsect2.para: Maybe we need to add here something

refsect2.title: Related information
refsect2.para: Links to external docs (QT-contacts, Qt-Landmarks would be nice)

refsect2.title: nco:IMAccount
refsect2.para: An account in an Instant Messaging system. This refers to IM accounts of the user 'me'.

refsect2.title: nco:PcsNumber
refsect2.para: Personal Communication Services Number. A class inspired by the TYPE=pcs parameter of the TEL property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.3.1

refsect2.title: nco:PersonContact
refsect2.para: A Contact that denotes a Person. A person can have multiple Affiliations.

listitem.simpara: nco:hasAffiliation, nco:gender, nco:hobby, nco:nameHonorificPrefix, nco:nameHonorificSuffix, nco:nameAdditional, nco:nameGiven, nco:nameFamily,

refsect2.title: nco:VoicePhoneNumber
refsect2.para: A telephone number with voice communication capabilities. Class inspired by the TYPE=voice parameter of the TEL property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.3.1

refsect2.title: nco:MessagingNumber
refsect2.para: A number that can accept textual messages.

refsect2.title: nco:BbsNumber
refsect2.para: A Bulletin Board System (BBS) phone number. Inspired by the (TYPE=bbsl) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:Gender
refsect2.para: Gender. Instances of this class may include male and female.

refsect2.title: nco:ContactMedium
refsect2.para: A superclass for all contact media - ways to contact an entity represented by a Contact instance. Some of the subclasses of this class (the various kinds of telephone numbers and postal addresses) have been inspired by the values of the TYPE parameter of ADR and TEL properties defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.2.1. and 3.3.1 respectively. Each value is represented by an appropriate subclass with two major exceptions TYPE=home and TYPE=work. They are to be expressed by the roles these contact media are attached to i.e. contact media with TYPE=home parameter are to be attached to the default role (nco:Contact or nco:PersonContact), whereas media with TYPE=work parameter should be attached to nco:Affiliation or nco:OrganizationContact.

refsect2.title: nco:CellPhoneNumber
refsect2.para: A cellular phone number. Inspired by the (TYPE=cell) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1. Usually a cellular phone can accept voice calls as well as textual messages (SMS), therefore this class has two superclasses.

refsect2.title: nco:Role
refsect2.para: A role played by a contact. Contacts that denote people, can have many roles (e.g. see the hasAffiliation property and Affiliation class). Contacts that denote Organizations or other Agents usually have one role. Each role can introduce additional contact media.

listitem.simpara: nco:video, nco:hasIMAddress, nco:hasPostalAddress, nco:blogUrl, nco:foafUrl, nco:hasEmailAddress, nco:websiteUrl, nco:hasPhoneNumber, nco:url, nco:hasContactMedium,

refsect2.title: nco:IsdnNumber
refsect2.para: An ISDN phone number. Inspired by the (TYPE=isdn) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:ContactList
refsect2.para: A contact list, this class represents an addressbook or a contact list of an IM application. Contacts inside a contact list can belong to contact groups.

refsect2.title: nco:VideoTelephoneNumber
refsect2.para: A Video telephone number. A class inspired by the TYPE=video parameter of the TEL property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.3.1

refsect2.title: nco:DomesticDeliveryAddress
refsect2.para: Domestic Delivery Addresse. Class inspired by TYPE=dom parameter of the ADR property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.2.1

refsect2.title: nco:FaxNumber
refsect2.para: A fax number. Inspired by the (TYPE=fax) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:OrganizationContact
refsect2.para: A Contact that denotes on Organization.

refsect2.title: nco:PhoneNumber
refsect2.para: A telephone number.

refsect2.title: nco:IMAddress
refsect2.para: An instant messaging address such as xmpp:foo@bar.com.

listitem.simpara: nco:imAddressAuthStatusTo, nco:imAddressAuthStatusFrom, nco:imCapability, nco:presenceLastModified, nco:imPresence, nco:imStatusMessage, nco:imProtocol, nco:imAvatar, nco:imNickname, nco:imID,

refsect2.title: nco:PresenceStatus
refsect2.para: Predefined set of status level instances

listitem.simpara: nco:presence-status-error, nco:presence-status-unknown, nco:presence-status-busy, nco:presence-status-hidden, nco:presence-status-extended-away, nco:presence-status-away, nco:presence-status-available, nco:presence-status-offline, nco:presence-status-unset,

refsect2.title: nco:PostalAddress
refsect2.para: A postal address. A class aggregating the various parts of a value for the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.2.1.

listitem.simpara: nco:pobox, nco:district, nco:county, nco:locality, nco:postalcode, nco:streetAddress, nco:addressLocation, nco:extendedAddress, nco:country, nco:region,

refsect2.title: nco:EmailAddress
refsect2.para: An email address. The recommended best practice is to use mailto: uris for instances of this class.

refsect2.title: nco:CarPhoneNumber
refsect2.para: A car phone number. Inspired by the (TYPE=car) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:AuthorizationStatus
refsect2.para: Predefined instances to indicate the auth status: yes, no, requested

refsect2.title: nco:ModemNumber
refsect2.para: A modem phone number. Inspired by the (TYPE=modem) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:ContactGroup
refsect2.para: A group of Contacts. Could be used to express a group in an addressbook or on a contact list of an IM application. One contact can belong to many groups.

refsect2.title: nco:ContactListDataObject
refsect2.para: An entity occuring on a contact list (usually interpreted as an nco:Contact)

refsect2.title: nco:ParcelDeliveryAddress
refsect2.para: Parcel Delivery Addresse. Class inspired by TYPE=parcel parameter of the ADR property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.2.1

refsect2.title: nco:IMCapability
refsect2.para: Features of a certain IM connection (depends on the IMAccount implementation used by the Contact)

listitem.simpara: nco:im-capability-dbus-tubes, nco:im-capability-stream-tubes, nco:im-capability-file-transfers, nco:im-capability-upgrading-calls, nco:im-capability-video-calls, nco:im-capability-audio-calls, nco:im-capability-media-calls, nco:im-capability-text-chat,

refsect2.title: nco:PagerNumber
refsect2.para: A pager phone number. Inspired by the (TYPE=pager) parameter of the TEL property as defined in RFC 2426 sec 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:Affiliation
refsect2.para: Aggregates three properties defined in RFC2426. Originally all three were attached directly to a person. One person could have only one title and one role within one organization. This class is intended to lift this limitation.

refsect2.title: nco:InternationalDeliveryAddress
refsect2.para: International Delivery Addresse. Class inspired by TYPE=intl parameter of the ADR property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.2.1

refsect2.title: nco:Contact
refsect2.para: A Contact. A piece of data that can provide means to identify or communicate with an entity.

listitem.simpara: nco:sound, nco:belongsToGroup, nco:birthDate, nco:photo, nco:representative, nco:note, nco:nickname, nco:hasLocation, nco:contactLocalUID, nco:contactUID, nco:key, nco:fullname,

refsect2.title: nco:imAccountType
refsect2.para: Type of the IM account. This may be the name of the service that provides the IM functionality. Examples might include Jabber, ICQ, MSN etc

refsect2.title: nco:imID
refsect2.para: Identifier of the IM account. Examples of such identifier might include ICQ UINs, Jabber IDs, Skype names etc.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:imNickname
refsect2.para: A nickname attached to a particular IM address.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:region
refsect2.para: Region. Inspired by the fifth part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:country
refsect2.para: A part of an address specifying the country. Inspired by the seventh part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:publisher
refsect2.para: An entity responsible for making the InformationElement available.

refsect2.title: nco:representative
refsect2.para: An object that represent an object represented by this Contact. Usually this property is used to link a Contact to an organization, to a contact to the representative of this organization the user directly interacts with. An equivalent for the 'AGENT' property defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.5.4

refsect2.title: nco:imCapability
refsect2.para: Capabilities of an IM Contact, what can we interact with him

refsect2.title: nco:hasIMContact
refsect2.para: Indicates that this Instant Messaging account has the specified Instant Messaging address in the contact list.

refsect2.title: nco:streetAddress
refsect2.para: The streed address. Inspired by the third part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:contactMediumComment
refsect2.para: A comment about the contact medium.

refsect2.title: nco:logo
refsect2.para: Logo of a company. Inspired by the LOGO property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.5.3

refsect2.title: nco:contactLocalUID
refsect2.para: Unique ID for the contact in the local storage

refsect2.title: nco:nameAdditional
refsect2.para: Additional given name of an object represented by this contact. See documentation for 'nameFamily' property for details.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:contributor
refsect2.para: An entity responsible for making contributions to the content of the InformationElement.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:hasLocation
refsect2.para: Geographical location of the contact. Inspired by the 'GEO' property specified in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.4.2

refsect2.title: nco:contactGroupName
refsect2.para: The name of the contact group. This property was NOT defined in the VCARD standard. See documentation of the 'ContactGroup' class for details

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:sound
refsect2.para: Sound clip attached to a Contact. The DataObject refered to by this property is usually interpreted as an nfo:Audio. Inspired by the SOUND property defined in RFC 2425 sec. 3.6.6.

refsect2.title: nco:org
refsect2.para: Name of an organization or a unit within an organization the object represented by a Contact is associated with. An equivalent of the 'ORG' property defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.5.5

refsect2.title: nco:addressLocation
refsect2.para: The geographical location of a postal address.

refsect2.title: nco:hasIMAddress
refsect2.para: An address for communication using instant messages with the object specified by this contact.

refsect2.title: nco:imProtocol
refsect2.para: Protocol of the account ('skype', 'gtalk', 'icq', ...)

refsect2.title: nco:video
refsect2.para: Video avatar of a contact. Note that is an icon/avatar, not a generic 'present in video' property

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:birthDate
refsect2.para: Birth date of the object represented by this Contact. An equivalent of the 'BDAY' property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.1.5.

refsect2.title: nco:containsContact
refsect2.para: A property used to group contacts into contact groups. This property was NOT defined in the VCARD standard. See documentation for the 'ContactList' class for details

refsect2.title: nco:blogUrl
refsect2.para: A Blog url.

refsect2.title: nco:creator
refsect2.para: Creator of a data object, an entity primarily responsible for the creation of the content of the data object.

refsect2.title: nco:hasContactMedium
refsect2.para: A superProperty for all properties linking a Contact to an instance of a contact medium.

refsect2.title: nco:contactUID
refsect2.para: A value that represents a globally unique identifier corresponding to the individual or resource associated with the Contact. An equivalent of the 'UID' property defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.6.7

refsect2.title: nco:note
refsect2.para: A note about the object represented by this Contact. An equivalent for the 'NOTE' property defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.6.2

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:foafUrl
refsect2.para: The URL of the FOAF file.

refsect2.title: nco:hasEmailAddress
refsect2.para: An address for electronic mail communication with the object specified by this contact. An equivalent of the 'EMAIL' property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.3.1.

refsect2.title: nco:locality
refsect2.para: Locality or City. Inspired by the fourth part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:district
refsect2.para: Local division inside a city. Not in RFC 2426 sec 3.2.1. Added for API compatibility

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:nameHonorificSuffix
refsect2.para: A suffix for the name of the Object represented by the given object. See documentation for the 'nameFamily' for details.

refsect2.title: nco:websiteUrl
refsect2.para: A url of a website.

refsect2.title: nco:nameFamily
refsect2.para: The family name of an Object represented by this Contact. These applies to people that have more than one given name. The 'first' one is considered 'the' given name (see nameGiven) property. All additional ones are considered 'additional' names. The name inherited from parents is the 'family name'. e.g. For Dr. John Phil Paul Stevenson Jr. M.D. A.C.P. we have contact with: honorificPrefix: 'Dr.', nameGiven: 'John', nameAdditional: 'Phil', nameAdditional: 'Paul', nameFamily: 'Stevenson', honorificSuffix: 'Jr.', honorificSuffix: 'M.D.', honorificSuffix: 'A.C.P.'. These properties form an equivalent of the compound 'N' property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.1.2

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:imAccountAddress
refsect2.para: Instant Messaging address of this IM account. The user 'me' can send and receive messages from this IM address.

refsect2.title: nco:nameHonorificPrefix
refsect2.para: A prefix for the name of the object represented by this Contact. See documentation for the 'nameFamily' property for details.

refsect2.title: nco:hasAffiliation
refsect2.para: Links a PersonContact with an Affiliation.

refsect2.title: nco:gender
refsect2.para: Gender of the given contact.

refsect2.title: nco:imAddressAuthStatusTo
refsect2.para: Do i authorize this im Account to receive my information

refsect2.title: nco:extendedAddress
refsect2.para: An extended part of an address. This field might be used to express parts of an address that aren't include in the name of the Contact but also aren't part of the actual location. Usually the streed address and following fields are enough for a postal letter to arrive. Examples may include ('University of California Campus building 45', 'Sears Tower 34th floor' etc.) Inspired by the second part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:imStatusMessage
refsect2.para: A feature common in most IM systems. A message left by the user for all his/her contacts to see.

refsect2.title: nco:key
refsect2.para: An encryption key attached to a contact. Inspired by the KEY property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.7.2

refsect2.title: nco:imAvatar
refsect2.para: A picture attached to a particular IM address.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:url
refsect2.para: A uniform resource locator associated with the given role of a Contact. Inspired by the 'URL' property defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.6.8.

refsect2.title: nco:postalcode
refsect2.para: Postal Code. Inspired by the sixth part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:hasPhoneNumber
refsect2.para: A number for telephony communication with the object represented by this Contact. An equivalent of the 'TEL' property defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.3.1

refsect2.title: nco:photo
refsect2.para: Photograph attached to a Contact. The DataObject refered to by this property is usually interpreted as an nfo:Image. Inspired by the PHOTO property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.1.4

refsect2.title: nco:nameGiven
refsect2.para: The given name for the object represented by this Contact. See documentation for 'nameFamily' property for details.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:nickname
refsect2.para: A nickname of the Object represented by this Contact. This is an equivalen of the 'NICKNAME' property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.1.3.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:hobby
refsect2.para: A hobby associated with a PersonContact. This property can be used to express hobbies and interests.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:department
refsect2.para: Department. The organizational unit within the organization.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search
This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:presenceLastModified
refsect2.para: Timestamp of the last change in the presence status

refsect2.title: nco:pobox
refsect2.para: Post office box. This is the first part of the value of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426, sec. 3.2.1

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:imDisplayName
refsect2.para: The user-visible name of this account. This SHOULD be chosen by the user at account creation time. The account creation user interface is responsible for setting a reasonable default value in the user's locale; something like 'Jabber (bob@example.com)' would be sensible.

refsect2.title: nco:fullname
refsect2.para: To specify the formatted text corresponding to the name of the object the Contact represents. An equivalent of the FN property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.1.1.

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:imAddressAuthStatusFrom
refsect2.para: Has the other end authorize to receive information about his changes

refsect2.title: nco:hasPostalAddress
refsect2.para: The default Address for a Contact. An equivalent of the 'ADR' property as defined in RFC 2426 Sec. 3.2.1.

refsect2.title: nco:county
refsect2.para: Regional division between state and city. Not in RFC 2426 sec 3.2.1. Added for API compatibility

listitem.simpara: This property is indexed, so it can provide results on text search

refsect2.title: nco:voiceMail
refsect2.para: Indicates if the given number accepts voice mail. (e.g. there is an answering machine). Inspired by TYPE=msg parameter of the TEL property defined in RFC 2426 sec. 3.3.1

refsect2.title: nco:belongsToGroup
refsect2.para: Links a Contact with a ContactGroup it belongs to.
